List of Events Terms Tables by Highest Grade

lt_events_per_term_grade_id_2.Rd

lt_events_per_term_grade_id_2 returns a nested list of events tables by max grade (t_max_grade_per_id).

lt_events_per_term_grade_id_2(terms, id, grade, col_by, col_N,
  total = "All Patients", grade_levels)

Arguments

terms

character or factor vector, or dataframe to represent events information; Currently terms can only be a vector or dataframe with 1 or 2 columns. For terms with 2 columns, 1st column should represent higher level term and 2nd column should be lower level term. var_relabel is used as the character string used as a label in the column header for each term.
id

vector of subject identifier. Length of id must be the same as the length or number of rows of terms.
grade

grade of adverse event as numeric. var_relabel is used as the character string used as a label in the column header for each grade.
col_by

factor with reference and comparison group information, the first level indicates the reference group.
col_N

numeric vector with information of the number of patients in the levels of col_by. This is useful if there are patients that have no adverse events can be accounted for with this argument.
total

character string that will be used as a label for a column with total population. If the levels of col_by are the only columns of interest then total should be NULL.
grade_levels

numeric, ordered values of possible of grades in a form of x:y, default is 1:5.

Value

rtable

Details

The data is split and table functions are applied to leaf nodes as follows:

See also

t_max_grade_per_id, t_events_per_term_grade_id, lt_events_per_term_grade_id_1, t_events_per_term_id

Examples


library(dplyr)
library(random.cdisc.data)

ADSL <- radsl(10, seed = 1)
ADAE <- radae(ADSL, 4, seed = 2)

l_tbls <- tern:::lt_events_per_term_grade_id_2(
  terms = ADAE %>% select(AEBODSYS, AEDECOD),
  id = ADAE$USUBJID,
  grade = ADAE$AETOXGR,
  col_by = ADAE$ARM,
  col_N = table(ADSL$ARM),
  total = "All Patients",
  grade_levels = 1:5
)

tern:::recursive_stack_rtables(tern:::nl_remove_n_first_rrows(l_tbls, 1,2))
